page.title: 04OLD AND NEW CHILDREN'S GAMES
page.content: Games have changed since 1945 except one of the most popular games in those days,{Hopscotch,}which we still play now. Some of the other games which we don't play now were {Whip and Top, Checks, Blocks and Shine {-a-light.}To play{Checks}you had to mark circles on the ground with scores in them then you would throw coloured discs into the circles, whoever got the highest score won. They didn't use all the modern equipment we use now. They used mostly sticks and stones . Some of the most interesting games were played by the boys such as{Hunch {Cuddy Hunch, Guinea Pig, Tin Can Spot, {Run Sheep Run and Shine-a-light.}About three years ago{Christ Church School started to play{Boule or Petanque,}a French game which was first played in Provence.We hold annual Singles and Doubles Boule Championships in school.
